result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd Richard Hause was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Todd Richard Hause is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Todd Richard Hause was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 1.
Defendant to report to Probation today July 7, 2017 by 4:00 p.m.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Daniel Frank Demaio, DF: Todd Richard Hause appeared.  Court called.  Set for FPT.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct. 2.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

- Ct. 2 in 15CM633
- W/S 1 year probation with conditions
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing pursuant to the Day Report Center protocols. If UA testing is required, the same shall be viewed in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex. Additional testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.  
- Domestic abuse assessment.
- DE to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Alisha Olson.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- DE to report to probation today 07/07/17 by 4:00 p.m.
- F/F or $500 apply money on file and 30 DTP on remaining balance
- 20 days to appeal
Per payment - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif

per Defendant in court. eif
Pre-trial conference at 12-16-2015 09:45 am

Bond on file. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Alisha O.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Todd Richard Hause appeared. Court confirms address.
